page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE BLOCK
page.content: Largely residential,this block covers an area of Luton that has grown very quickly since World War 2.Closer to the town centre,properties are pre 1st War and inter-War,but the majority of squares in the block contain recent developments.Two of the most important roads in the County run through the block,Dunstable Road,which joins Luton to Dunstable,which at peak hours is one of the busiest roads in the South of England and the M1 Motorway.Luton and Dunstable General Hospital,with its specialised accident service is on the Motorway junction and close by are several Hotels,catering for the Traveller.Because of the rapid growth in the block,there are many schools,but comparatively litle industry.Since W.W.2,people from many other lands have come to live in Luton mainly from Asia and the West Indies.
